WE ARE FUNDED - THANK YOU! 
Want to get updates on development? Subscribe to our newsletter!
Want to Wishlist the game on Steam? Do that here!
You can also Follow us on Twitter or join our Discord.

ABOUT THE GAME
Whisker Squadron is our fresh take on forward scrolling aerial combat, featuring feline heroes, dynamic missions, and procedurally generated bosses and worlds!
Coming to PC and consoles in 2022
 Wishlist on Steam | Website | Twitter | Facebook | 

Hey everyone! 
We are Flippfly, the team behind 2013's Race The Sun. We are so excited to let you know about our new project, Whisker Squadron!
Click banner to wishlist Whisker Squadron right now!
Whisker Squadron is the culmination of a creative spark that was lit over 20 years ago, and that has burned in us through our careers, and strengthened by modern indie games. When we created Race The Sun in 2013, we took aesthetic cues from classic low-poly games like Star Fox for the Super Nintendo, and created something with a uniquely minimalist feeling that was loved by our fans. Ever since that project shipped, we’ve talked about creating a follow up that was more combat-focused, and that pushed the procedurally-generated elements even further.

Whisker Squadron is that game.

Choose your pilot and fight your way through procedurally-generated worlds and epic, procedurally-generated boss fights. You've got one life, and your tactical upgrade choices will be crucial to your success in this aerial roguelike.

Engage in epic aerial combat with your feline pilot of choice
Take on a series of epic, procedurally-generated boss fights
Fight your way through dynamic worlds in a mission that's unique every time you play it
And there's more:
Procedurally generated, rogue-like mission structure that's unique every time you play
Incredibly dynamic procedurally-generated bosses that make for intense climax to every act
Choose your pilots from a cast of 3 feline heroes
Daily challenges and leaderboards
Don't just take our word for it! Here is what the games press is saying about Whisker Squadron:
“Some of the bosses look downright inspired” - PC Gamer 
“If this is where the game is starting in the public eye, I can’t wait to see where it ends up.” - Polygon 
“It's early days yet, but yeah, I'd play this” - Rock Paper Shotgun 
“While on the surface Whisker Squadron looks like Starfox with cats, the addition of Race the Sun’s elements make it a very different game.” - Hardcore Gamer 
“The foundation of a tried and true rail shooter mixed with procedurally-generated level design, roguelike gameplay, and striking art design is a solid one for Flippfly.” - Shacknews 
Whisker Squadron is a corridor shooter with procedurally generated worlds, some light roguelike elements, and a cast of cats! Pilot your ship, avoiding obstacles and blasting the autonomous bots built by the sinister PAW Technologies corporation in an effort to save the galaxy from out of control algorithms bent on planetary destruction.

The game follows an action rogue-like formula: You get a single life to play through a 3-act campaign through several worlds and random space encounters, each with their own looks and threats. Challenge yourself to acquire higher rankings by avoiding damage, blasting all the bots, and keeping your multiplier high to earn the most rewards for beating each world.
Challenge isn't everything, so we also offer a set of customizable gameplay settings instead of traditional difficulty settings. Start with more shields on your ship? Encounter less enemies? Get health pickups at the end of each world? Go for it!
And if you want a nightmare, the settings will be there for you masochist-cats as well...mewhahaha
Dynamic mission map

Play as multiple characters, each with their own unique special weapon. Along the way you'll encounter shops and events to acquire a choice of new weapons and items to powerup as you make your way across the galaxy to stop the bots. Each play-through is unique, with each world being procedurally generated from a set of 'pattern' chunks, and a map that presents different connections and choices.
And it's not just the worlds which are generated: each act culminates with an epic battle against a large enemy bot, and the bots are always looking for improvements so you'll have to keep on your toes each play-through because this bot is procedurally generated for a unique battle each time!
Jin is our character artist, and has drawn our wonderful cast of cats. Here's a few of them:
Sean is leading the way on the visual development for the game, using the custom world editor that we’ve built for this game. We’re evolving the minimalist style we developed with Race The Sun, and adding layers of visual flair on top. What you see on this Kickstarter page is a work-in-progress. We’re improving the visuals more every week, and we’re confident that the final look will blow you away.
We’re also super excited to be working with Chel Wong on the game’s original soundtrack. Chel has an amazing range of styles and really nailed the feeling that we’re going for with this game. You can hear her work in the trailer above!

Here’s what Chel has to say about working on the Soundtrack:
“For the soundtrack I have so many ideas I'm excited to work on! I plan on taking some influence from predecessors in the genre but also going to be putting my own spin on things. And as is my specialty, I can't wait to see what kind of adaptive layers I can put into this soundtrack to react to gameplay!

SOUNDTRACK PREVIEW
here's a little preview of what Chel's cooking up for the soundtrack. This is the track for Lunar Canyon, along with the "boss variant" that will play at the end level boss fight.
(Note: this is a work-in progress, Chel is still in the process of adding some sweet guitars!)
Here are a few of the more unique Kickstarter-exclusive rewards we're offering!

PUT YOURSELF IN THE GAME ($200 and above)
You'll send us a photo of yourself, your pet or anything that's age-appropriate, and we'll add it to an object in a special "Easter egg" level that players can access in the game itself!
Put yourself in the secret level, rough concept
ADD YOUR FURRY FRIEND ($500 and above) 
You'll send us a picture of your pet, or some artwork of your personal animal persona, and we'll add it to the game as a secret playable character, unlocked with a unique cheat code.
Your furry friend in the game, rough concept
CUSTOM SHOUT OUT $1000 and above)
We'll send you a survey and code up a special conversation with the characters in the game, who will give you a shout-out by name, activated by a special personal cheat code. We'll work with you to make it special!
Custom shout-out, rough concept
Aaron San Filippo is a co-founder of Flippfly and the company’s lead programmer. He’s overseeing production and code, building new tools to support the design of the game, and coordinating the team. He also built the prototype for the game and helps out with design.

Sean Campbell is the designer and creative director. Sean helped Flippfly build Race The Sun’s portal worlds, and has returned as the world creator and Whisker Squadron’s creative director. He’s also leading the efforts on the game’s 3D art. 
Aaron, Sean, Chel, Jin, Chris, and Zaire

Chel Wong is a seasoned composer with multiple game soundtracks to her name. Chel works in a variety of styles with an incredible range, and she’s creating an awesome original soundtrack for Whisker Squadron.

Chris Atkins joined Flippfly recently as a programmer, and is helping flesh out Whisker Squadron’s gameplay.

Jin Li is a concept artist and animator from Sydney, Australia. She created and drew all of the characters for Whisker Squadron and contributed concept design.

Zaire Lanier is a writer and narrative designer from the Midwestern US. She's creating a comic called The Bone Herder, and will be helping create the WS universe, characters, and in-game dialog.
June 2021: beta-level backers and above get early access to the beta on PC
December 2021: game is content-complete and enters final phase of testing
May 2022: The game launches and all backers get a PC copy
July 2022: All physical and digital rewards are delivered.
Most of the funding for Whisker Squadron comes directly from Flippfly. We have been working on this game for about a year, and we are in a fortunate situation where Race The Sun and our other games are providing a steady income stream that’s allowed us to work on the game. However, this Kickstarter will be essential for getting us over the finish line, and if we reach our stretch goals, will allow us to create an even better game, and guarantee an on-time delivery.

We’ve invested a lot of Flippfly funds in Whisker Squadron already, supporting a small core team to build about 1/3rd of the game so far. We are on Kickstarter to raise funds to help finish the game and expand our team. This money will help us create an original soundtrack, add additional features, and finish the game sooner.
Your support means the world to us! Our fans have always been central to Flippfly’s success, and you are quite literally making this project possible. Thanks for coming along for the ride and being a part of our dream project!

* Platforms:
At this time, we are planning for Steam, Epic Games Store on PC. We're also looking into PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch We will finalize these plans in the coming months and keep you updated! Backers will get a key on their choice of PC stores. 

We are planning on supporting Windows, Mac, and Linux on PC.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Running a videogame business always carries a certain amount of risk. We're creating a unique new product, and there's a possibility some elements won't work out the way we planned.

However, Flippfly has shipped 4 full titles across half a dozen platforms, and we feel confident that we'll be able to deliver on this project as-promised and on time!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey all, I wanted to give a special shout-out to a friend's campaign that I think many of you may be interested in. Laura from Pronoia has been helping out with our Whisker Squadron campaign from the start, and now she and her team are creating a really cool comic book called The Lost Sunday.

Press Kit  |  Discord  |  Twitter  |  Instagram  |  Tik Tok  |  Website  | Wishlist on Steam | 
Spirit Swap: Lofi Beats to Match-3 To is an action-puzzle game set in a lush, narrative-driven world of witchy demons. Cast spells, be queer, & crash the biggest concert of the year!
By night, use Samar’s powers to help send transdimensional spirits back home. By day, roam the city and chat with friends, planning the ultimate pizza party for everyone to come together and catch up.
 Match to the beat as you reassemble lost spirits, and enjoy a custom lofi soundtrack by the incredible Meltycanon.
 Cast powerful spells. Arrange spirits into special patterns to unlock potent powers!
 Compete in local VS mode! Everything is chill, until it gets permanently unchill....
 Enjoy over 5 unique game modes, including Time Attack, Score Attack, and Survival.
 Bond with a cast of witches and demons. Plan a pizza party together, crash a concert, maybe even smooch in our extensive Story Mode!
 Decorate your bedroom. Earn trinkets and keepsakes as you play, then place them in Samar’s room to affect the game!
 No microtransactions here. Spirit Swap is a premium game, which means you'll be able to enjoy it without worrying about hidden costs.
 Queer and diverse joy. Much like the cast of Spirit Swap, our team is also is queer, Black, and/or POC, and it's well past time we see ourselves experiencing happiness in media. This is a slice-of-life story for players needing a relaxing experience!
 A fresh look at Middle Eastern fantasy by creators FROM the region. Spirit Swap is set in a fictional city inspired by the Levant, a region rarely explored (in a positive light) in games.
Samar - the main character!
Mo + Leon - the coolest people you know with soft centers.
the Polycule - these hot people are all dating wow
Pookie - giant teddy bear and BFF4LIFE
There are few things Ishk loves more than carb loading at Lulu's bakery, but maybe there’s something other than pastries that keeps him coming back around.
AND MORE CHARACTERS THAT WE'LL INTRODUCE AS THE CAMPAIGN PROGRESSES!
 NEW CHARACTER REVEAL: KANON

who ARE they????
 Match-3 action meets visual novel storytelling in Spirit Swap!
Inspired by Panel de Pon, Spirit Swap lets you use a keyboard or controller to move spirits into groups of three or more to help reassemble their forms, and send them back to their proper dimension. Throughout the game, you’ll improve your magical abilities and learn new spells by exploring the world and talking to your friends.
Story Mode progresses through various areas of the city, cleaning up different “hot spots” where transdimensional spirits have accidentally crossed over.
Outside of Story Mode, there will be additional game modes -- Time Attack and Score Attack will be available for those up for the challenge. For anyone wanting a chill experience (perhaps to help wind down for the evening), Endless Mode will be available as well!
Bhyg Mode will also be available! It's a local-versus mode where you can compete with up to seven other friends (eight players total) on a wonderfully chaotic shared board!
There’s more to life than work, though, and Samar and their friends will have opportunities to hang out, chat, and bond! Depending on who you visit and when, you’ll be able to develop a deeper relationship; plan a pizza party together, go to a concert… maybe even smooch! 
As Samar’s bonds with her friends grow deeper you’ll unlock unique dialogue, spells, and items. You’ll also be able to decorate Samar’s bedroom using those trinkets and keepsakes, and each of these will provide different boons to your match-3 strategy, in addition to making Samar’s room feel like home!
Spirit Swap’s world is inspired by the devs’ love for their Lebanese roots, lo-fi and wired technology, and the 90’s colorful aesthetic with a sprinkle of demonic vaporwave.
Samar is a young witch working the spirit-swapping night shift in the eastern outskirts of Demashq. A recent spike in spirits crossing over from another dimension breaks the chill atmosphere of their night shift. With her trusty FamiliarZ by her side, she sets off into the city to find out what’s happened. With the popular band, 5SOME, scheduled to kick off their big comeback tour in Demashq, Samar needs to work quickly before the city is overrun with stans and spirits alike....not to mention, they've got a pizza party to plan, and romance to pursue!
Spirit Swap takes place in Demashq, a coastal city inspired by the Levantine cities of our own world, Damascus and Beirut.
The game follows Samar as they make their way from their home right outside the city, by the nearby forest, into the sprawling coastal city of Demashq where they meet their friends.
one of Samar's possible paths through Demashq
It reflects the Levant’s general topography, nature, architecture and climate (middle eastern Mediterranean) as well as cultural references, vibrancy, and visual cues.
A setting seldom explored in games outside the lens of orientalism, and almost never by people from that part of the world themselves.
Spirit Swap’s in-world magic draws on two main things: plants and community. Plants and nature are the source of all magic and humans when banded together act as amplifiers and users. The world is one parallel to ours where plant magic was democratized around the turn of the millenia instead of wireless communication. Magic and tech have become deeply intertwined.
In a world where magic is at everyone’s fingertips, everyone needs a helping hand. For witches and demons alike, Familiars serve that purpose.
In the past, summoning a Familiar was a lengthy process.  Charting the constellations, preparing the ritual, and massive energy drain directly following the manifestation of an individual’s soul became less popular in modern times.  Yet, the need for a Familiar’s assistance and companionship did not.
FamiliarZ Concept Art
FamiliarZ were created to solve the problem; tech-assisted miniature devices that allow anyone to manifest a Familiar without the expense of magical energy required to sustain it.  With casings ranging from fashionable keychains to portable cassette players, witches and demons choose personalized ways to interact with their Familiar without having to reveal to the public any aspect of their inner selves.
FamiliarZ Concept Art
For press interested in covering our Kickstarter, here are some screenshots and promo material to get you started!
Our soundtrack and sound design are created by Meltycanon and eyelovebrandon. The audio team is led by Rejon Taylor-Foster.
For Spirit Swap, the soundtrack was inspired by the music our team is currently drawn to: lofi hip-hop. We wanted to create a game, and soundtrack, that you truly could relax to!
Please keep in mind: the reward images are mock-ups and WIPs, and the final products may look different. Thank you for understanding!

The Game
A PC/Mac digital download of the game to enjoy! 
Soundtrack
A download of the Spirit Swap original soundtrack by our composers, meltycanon and EyeLoveBrandon. You can listen to melty’s main theme for the game <here>!
Digital Art Book
A digital PDF stuffed with art for all of the characters, spirits, and backgrounds, all the way from early concepts to final assets. The book will also include lore and exclusive character profiles for the whole cast.
Spirit Magnets
Featuring custom art of Samar and 3 of the spirits done by the incredible Hannako Lambert! These magnets will be die-cut and come as a complete set of 4.
Limited Edition Spirit Swap Print
A custom 5”x7” art print done by the amazing Bampshi, featuring some of the Spirit Swap characters, they will be glossy prints and include holographic foil detailing.
Musical Spirits Pin
This pin was designed by Hannako Lambert and includes reflective accents and a rubber clutch.
Samar Shaker Charm
A gorgeous charm designed by Pontata featuring Samar over a board filled with tiny moving spirits, and a gold star key ring!
Neon Spirit Swap Hoodie/T-Shirt
This hoodie, designed by Hannako Lambert, comes as either a crop top hoodie, or a unisex cotton t-shirt. Hoodie sizing goes from XS to 2XL, and t-shirt sizing from XS to 6XL!
Design an outfit
Join our artists and create the perfect outfit for Samar to flaunt her powers in, usable in game and fully animated! Have input at every step of this process with our artists and animators, and get your name in the credits
Design a decoration
You can make a cozy object that our little witch uses to decorate her room! You help us make the look and write the lore, and get your name in the credits.
Rewards + Tiers Overview
Soft Not Weak consists of 5 worker-owners.
Co-devs Truant Pixel are Souha and M. The game wouldn't be what it is without the efforts of the contractors we work with, too! Thank you to our entire dev team below!



We've teamed up with the lovely folks at Dual Wield Studio for merch development and fulfillment, so you'll have seasoned pros delivering you the best goods possible!
  why are games so expensive to make ha ha
A successful Kickstarter gives our team the opportunity to make the game of our dreams (and hopefully yours!)

We have been working on this title for 8 months now, and have made great progress: this funding will allow us to dive even further into making Spirit Swap the game we’d love it to be.

The ability for Kickstarter to connect us quickly with a community of people as excited about Spirit Swap as we are is also something we wanted to explore. We’re excited to share developmental progress and all of the fun game elements we have in store with our community! Thank you for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With the expertise of our team, having been a part of 11 shipped titles and various facets of the game industry, we are confident Spirit Swap is happening, one way or another!

What this Kickstarter campaign will do is help determine just how far we can go with this title. Our hope is that this campaign can give us the financial boost to add content, potentially bring it to consoles, and make sure it’s polished so that the final Spirit Swap experience is an incredible one. We’ve also partnered with Dual Wield Studio -- the merch partner for other games like Among Us and Best Friends Forever -- to ensure experience and support for physical reward deliveries.

Even with significant experience and preparation, game development can be unpredictable and delays are always a possibility. If the game feels unfinished, we prefer to continue working on it and delay its release until we are confident that you will enjoy the result! Thank you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Mock up of the book. Cover design not finalized.
Coyote and Crow is a tabletop role playing game set in an alternate future of the Americas where colonization never occurred. Instead, advanced civilizations arose over hundreds of years after a massive climate disaster changed the history of the planet. You'll play as adventurers starting out in the city of Cahokia, a bustling, diverse metropolis along the Mississippi River. It's a world of science and spirituality where the future of technology and legends of the past will collide.

The game is created and led by a team of Native Americans representing more than a dozen tribes and we've built a game that both Natives and non-Natives will thrill to explore and build upon.
More than 700 years ago, a bright purple streak shot across the night sky. Over the coming weeks, the Earth fell into a deep winter, the seas raged and ash rained from the sky. The event became known as the Awis. As resources dwindled, winter became longer and summer shorter, people struggled to survive. Wars erupted, people starved, some fleeing their ancestral homes before creeping ice sheets. 
But people survived. Tribes adapted. And in the wake, people began to notice a strange purple mark appearing on people, plants and animals alike. It became known as the Adahnehdi, the Gift, and many took it as a sign that the Great Spirit had not given up on them. 
Eventually, the weather began to ease, the Earth began to heal, and new nations arose. New sciences and technologies, born out of necessity, led to a discovery about the Adahnehdi. It wasn't just a mark, it was a path to abilities and powers, beyond normal human limits. 
The long walk home. Art by Jennifer Lange
Now, 700 years after the world was brought to the brink, a new chapter has begun. Your characters enter a world that is healing but is no less dangerous. The ice sheets are retreating and the seas are calming, but what lay out beyond your borders? The treaties and alliances that made so much sense during the long winters are now eroding and old grudges between nations are not so easily forgotten. New technologies arise almost every day and the rate of change is frightening for some. And then there are the stories. Talk of spirits, monsters, beings of legend. For so many they were just tales to be told around the fire. But now there is talk that these legends may be far more literal than you may have previously believed. Has something awakened them?
the northern continent of Makasing.
Coyote and Crow is an original role playing system built around the exclusive use of D12 dice. Outside of the core rule book, all you'll need to play the game is some pencil and paper and some twelve-sided dice. While there is some complexity to the game, we are striving to present a system that will allow players to refer to the rule book during play as little as possible, keeping most or all of the critical information on your character sheet.
Mock up of the front of a character sheet. Design not finalized.
The basic rule system is centered around collecting a Dice Pool, usually around 5-7 D12s and rolling them to determine either Success or Failure and degree of effect. For example "8" might be the number your Character needs to attempt to do something and every 8 or higher they rolled would be a Success. The more 8's, the more successful they are. 
While combat is a part of Coyote and Crow, the game is actually built around the idea of fighting being only one road to story resolution. The game encourages dialogue, building bridges and finding unique solutions to problems that are not always clearly defined by good and evil. 
Your Characters have Stats like Strength and Spirit and Skills like Investigation and Charm that are modified by their Stats. In addition, when you create your Character, you choose a Path. That Path determines both certain Stat bonuses you receive as well as which Abilities you have access to. Abilities are powers beyond normal human capability, but not at a level where characters would be comparable to superheroes. There are 15 Paths in the core rule book available. In addition, you'll choose an Archetype (Whisperer, Healer, Scout, among others) that will give you Stat and Skill bonuses and a general idea of your character's profession, but will not force your Character too deeply down a specific progression.
Then you'll choose Gifts and Burdens. These allow you to give your Characters specific bonuses or drawbacks and will help you flesh them out in a way that is flavorful and realistic. It's important to note that the rulebook does not dictate whether something is a burden or a gift for a Player. For example, a Player might choose to give their Character a sister. That might be a Burden or a Gift (or both!) depending on how the Player wants their Character to see that relationship.

Sample pages from the equipment chapter. Layouts and content not finalized.

There are no experience points in Coyote and Crow. Instead, it is built on the Legends system. Your Character will have Short Term Goals, which will increase various numbers on your Character sheets or give them new Skills. But you and your group will also have Long Term Goals. When those are completed your legend will grow. You'll write a short story about your adventures, the kind that can be told around the fire for generations to come. These can change your Gifts and Burdens, give you access to new Abilities and more. As you complete more Long Term Goals, your Character's legend will precede them and your stories will spread.

ARCHETYPES
There are six Archetypes in the game, each acting as a starting point for Character development but not constricting their possibilities. Each Archetype has its own symbol. Here are a few of them.
The icons for Warrior, Tinkerer, and Scout (not finalized)


PATHS
In addition to Archetypes, Players choose Paths for their Characters, which are permanent associations they make with an animal and help define what extra human Abilities they'll be able to choose from, among other effects. There are fifteen basic Paths in the core rulebook.
The Path of the Beaver, the Stag and the Spider
(See our Update for more on this)
While this game was created by a Native-led team, this game is for everyone. We've taken great care to craft a game that Natives and non-Natives alike will be able to engage in and find themselves immersed in. 
For Natives, we've crafted both story and game mechanics that will allow you to integrate your own tribal customs into your play. For those who aren't Native, you'll have a wealth of options to choose from as well as clear guidelines for understanding the differences between this world and our real one. 
The game is designed to be your first role playing game or your latest. The core rule book will walk players through every step of how to play Coyote and Crow, but also how to play role playing games in general, including advice on safety and inclusion as well as suggestions on where to find tools outside of the rule book to make your game both easier and more enjoyable.
Everyone involved in Coyote and Crow is deeply passionate about our game and we felt that it was time for Indigenous folks to have a game that didn't see them as secondary, as adversaries, or intertwined with colonialism.
Coyote and Crow is not set in a dystopia. The world went through a dark chapter, but the people of these nations rose to the challenge. There's good food and water, education and meaningful work for almost everyone in Makasing. 
But this world isn't a utopia either. It's place that's growing, where old alliances are strained and past slights are not always forgotten. New technology is putting pressure on old traditions. And with the climate becoming milder, there is a whole world of unknowns out there. On top of all of that, there are rumors that some of the old stories about monsters and spirits might just be a little more real than some originally believed. This is a game where science and the unexplained live side by side and sometimes clash.
The Wanderer. Art by Kyle Charles.

THE CORE RULE BOOK
We are producing a beautiful 300+ page hardbound book, loaded with illustrations and containing all of the rules you'll need to play Coyote and Crow. Included in the book (and PDF) will be:
Detailed history of this alternate world
Descriptions of daily life and culture in Cahokia, the capital of the Free Lands
Rules for creating and advancing your characters, including 6 Archetypes, 15 Paths and 27 Abilities for a massive variety of options
Descriptions and stats for mythical creatures, infamous spirits, shadowy organizations and dangerous cults that can challenge players endlessly
A group of pre-generated characters if you want to jump right into playing the game
A starter adventure, Encounter at Station 54, that can act as a stand alone adventure or as the start of a larger campaign
So much more!
SHIPPING
We will be shipping only to the US and Canada during this Kickstarter. In addition, we will be subsidizing a portion of the shipping costs within the Kickstarter itself to help keep costs down. If you are not in the US or Canada, not to worry. We have already partnered with traditional hobby distribution and the game will be available through your local hobby partners shortly after Kickstarter fulfillment. 
YOUR PLEDGE
 Whisperer: $5  This pledge shows your support for the project and allows you to keep abreast of all the future news about Coyote and Crow. We'll also notify you when late pledges are available after the campaign.
 Tinkerer: $20 With this pledge you get everything the Whisperer gets, plus a full color PDF version of the physical game, including all of the art. This version will be released shortly after we have sent our files to the printer and you'll have access to it before the physical copies have been delivered.
 Warrior: $50 (plus shipping)All of the benefits of both the Whisperer and the Tinkerer plus you'll get one full color hard cover edition and access to all Stretch Goals. You can choose to keep your physical copy of the book or donate it to a reservation library. If you donate, we'll handle the shipping. 
 Healer: $100 All of the benefits of Whisperer, Tinkerer, and Warrior, PLUS we'll ship a full hardcover copy of Coyote and Crow to a Native American reservation library in your honor. You pay for the shipping for your copy and we'll pay for the shipping to the reservation copy.
 Scout: $150 (plus shipping) For Friendly Local Games Stores Only. With this pledge you'll receive 6 copies of Coyote and Crow (1 case). You'll receive these at the same time as other Kickstarter backers, in advance of the general release.
 Seeker: $400 (plus shipping) (ALL GONE) For those that really want to support Coyote and Crow! All of the benefits of the Whisperer, Tinkerer, Warrior and Healer pledges, but your book will be signed and numbered by Connor Alexander. You'll also receive three high quality art prints of art used in the book (which ones, to be determined). This level is limited to 50 backers.
It still hungers. Art by Jeffrey Veregge
We have a diverse team of folks working on this game, most of whom are Native. Additionally, we are striving to bring in other marginalized voices whenever possible. Our team features people from across the LGBTQIA spectrum, including two spirit folks. It's not even a question that this game is political. If you have a problem with a game where there are no people of European descent represented, than this game is probably not for you. That said, we've truly built this game to be played by everyone. It might seem like a big leap, but don't worry, we're going to hold your hand the whole way through and you'll be so happy you stepped off the edge into this vibrant fresh world.

*We are continuing to add Native contributors throughout this project's development, so this list is not final.

I'd also like to add that this is a very personal project for me. While it's the first project I've created, I've been working in the games industry for 7 years and I've been a role player since 1978. For a long time I've wanted to create a game that speaks to my Native heritage in a way that's hopeful and positive. I'm proud of the team I've assembled (and am still adding to) and I'm confident that we have the experience, talent and determination to not only complete this project and deliver, but to bring you a truly memorable role playing experience.   - Connor Alexander, creator

updates.update_content:
Things are moving at a break neck pace, folks. There’s so much happening that it’s hard for me to summarize it all while also conveying how cool and exciting each of these things is. So, I’m splitting this update into two parts. We’ll talk about the where we’re at with production of everything related to the Kickstarter as well as other news. Then we’ll jump in to more game development discussion.
But first! A quick note! We’ve locked down current orders. Don’t worry, you can still pre-order or make late pledges through BackerKit and we haven’t locked down addresses yet. We’ll do that much later. So if you’re moving or not sure yet where you need your personal book shipped to, you have plenty of time. Also, please fill out your surveys if you haven’t yet. There are still around 1500 of you out there. Don’t make me wag my finger.

Folks, they are here!
A few of you may have already received them and for the rest of you, they'll be sent out in waves over the next few days. If you're new to Kickstarter, you'll be receiving an email from BackerKit, the pledge manager we're working with.  Here's what's in it and what you need to know.
If you pledged extra money over an amount for a pledge for an extra book, it should show as a credit in BackerKit. You'll be able to specify where you want that extra spent.
We'll be asking you a few questions, including: What products would you like to see from Coyote & Crow next, details on where you'd like donated copies sent to, questions about your retail stores, etc. Questions should only be relevant to your pledge.

Greetings!
With the campaign officially wrapped and the dust settling, we're finally in a position where we can give you all some news. Happy to report that it's all good stuff!
First, I want to thank all 16,269 of you that backed Coyote & Crow. It was more than just a vote of confidence in our game, it was a clear mandate for us to move forward with taking our RPG and launching a full fledged publishing operation.

We did it folks. In just 30 days we:
Smashed through our 18k original goal in just 45 minutes
Hit all of our original stretch goals in less than a week
Made waves across gaming media
Hit the $1 million+ mark, putting us in the top 6 RPG books of all time
earmarked 5000 books for donations to reservation and tribal libraries, schools and community centers (more on that below)

updates.update_userinfo: What About The Rest of the World? (And our next stretch goal!)
updates.update_content:
Hello again!
Today, I want to talk about a topic that a few people have asked about in a variety of ways. The essence of these questions really boil down to this. What's going on in other parts of the world outside of the Americas in this alternate future? In Coyote & Crow, we focus most closely on Cahokia, our starting city. We touch on the Free Lands and the other nations of Makasing and we'll even briefly outline the nations further south in what we call Abayang and Abazang (South and Central America).

Good morning C&C friends!
We've got just 10 days left in our Kickstarter and I'm getting so excited to announce our last stretch goal later this week if we hit that mark. I'll be able to give you the name and further details on the Native author who will hopefully be writing a one shot adventure for us!
But on to the update. A friend messaged me over the weekend and was already mulling some ideas for a Saga. Saga is what we call a series of adventures or stories, in lieu of campaign, which is often used in role playing games. We felt that campaign came off as too militaristic and we thought Saga worked well with terms like Story and Session, which we also use.

Hey, friends!
I've had a number of folks ask me why we chose to go with the d12 for our system. There's a few reasons and some of them might not be what you think. I thought I'd use my update today to fill you in on some fun trivia. The d12 and the number 12 itself play important roles in both the mechanics and the world building we're doing for Coyote & Crow.

Greetings folks!
Today, I want to talk a little bit about who should be playing this game. I've seen a trickle of concern that Coyote and Crow is something non-Natives shouldn't bring to their table. Before I get into how we've handled this situation in the text of the game itself, I wanted to share my broader thoughts on the topic.
To me, RPGs are about bringing people together, sharing stories and leaving the table with a collective experience that makes all of the players lives just a little bit brighter.

Hey folks,
Just a quick update. Today we hit another tremendous milestone. Thank you all so much for your continued generosity and support. Our whole crew is elated over the response to their work and we're all so excited to finish what we've started.
I also have  a slightly embarrassing situation to address. A very kind person pointed out that our icon for the Warrior was almost identical to the modern icon used in Black Power messaging. This was entirely an error on my part. I used a placeholder mock-up instead of our final icon and we've since remedied that. You can see the actual icon for the Warrior in the current image on the Campaign page. The icon that was there previously was an internal use only illustration that was meant as a developmental reference and was never intended for print.  I apologize to anyone who was confused or concerned, and I truly hope there was no offense caused.  We have the deepest respect for our Black allies and our icon was always meant as a nod to them.

Hoop Godz is a 2 player head-to-head street basketball board game that brings the skill, tension, excitement and competition of the sport to your tabletop! It requires strategic decision making as you move your players around the court and manage your team's energy with the unique JUICE system. Actions on the court lead to real-time dice battles to determine who comes out on top. 
Approachable mechanics for non-basketball and b-ball fans alike
Non-stop action from start to finish in under 45 minutes per game
Combines strategy and intensity in a highly thematic experience
Lots of replay value with 12 fierce ballers with unique skills 
Accessible game variant for players unable to roll dice in real-time 
Hoop Godz is available to play free during the campaign on Tabletopia.com
Note: Component count and component art is subject to change.
 Printable PDF Rulebook v0.8
In a standard game of HOOP GODZ, you win by being the first player to score 7 points.  Players will take turns, moving, passing, playing action cards, and facing off in real-time dice battle to see who rules the court. 
Here's an overview of the games main mechanics:
 Choose Your Ballers!  
The JUICE System
Using JUICE - You will need to take JUICE from the "Available JUICE" box and place it into the JUICE bar (filling the bar from left to right) for everything you want to do on the court. At the end of a turn, all JUICE in the bar moves down into the boxes below. 
 G.O.A.T. Cards - Whenever you end your turn and place JUICE in the red box, you can draw one rule-breaking game-changing G.O.A.T. Card from the deck.
Recovering JUICE - Ending your turn without placing any JUICE to the right of the "Rest" icon will let you recover 4 JUICE from the yellow box and move it to "Available".
Actions and Reactions
Basic Actions - MOVE, PASS, and BOOST. These cost 1 JUICE each and can be done on your turn or as a reaction to your opponent playing an Action Card.
Action Cards (Green) - Play these cards whenever you want to STEAL, CROSSOVER, SHOOT, or DUNK on your turn...but only if you have the JUICE!
Reaction Cards (Orange) - Play these cards in response to your opponent playing an Action Card. Whenever a Reaction Card is played it's time for a DICE BATTLE!

Dice Battles 
 Once both players have played Action and Reaction Cards and collected the appropriate number of dice based on their Ballers and Boosts...
READY....SET....ROLL! 
The first player to roll their dice and match the set of icons on the card they played is the winner of the dice battle and only their card goes into effect. 
...and that's all for the major mechanics in Hoop Godz!

Still going strong...
It's been a little while since we sent out and update and we've had to make some tough decisions and adjustments so here's the most important bits:
Solo Mode Development - I was able to put together a solid Solo Mode for Hoop Godz and I've consulted with a couple other more experienced solo designers to help me get it where it needs to be. It feels like it's very close to being done. You can check out an early-ish solo playthrough .

We're BACK! 
Hope everyone had pleasant holidays and a great start to the new year! It's 2021 and that means we can finally say that Hoop Godz and Rap Godz will hit shelves in your homes and in retail THIS YEAR! Sorry we didn't drop an update sooner. We started working on a few things in December and we've made some progress in a few key areas.

Manufacturing Agreement Signed!

YOU DID IT! 
...and we only need 35 more backers at ANY pledge level to hit the 1000 Backer goal!

Just a quick update that we are soooooo close to unlocking two stretch goals and we have LESS THAN 8 HOURS LEFT!
Please share the campaign and let everyone know that every $1 helps!

campaign.story:
We can't even begin to express how humbled and joyful we are about these last weeks. You have allowed us to make The Wagadu Chronicles even better that we thought it ever could be.
Thank you SO MUCH!
You can continue following the development of the game and books through our website and our social media: twitter, instagram & youtube.
And you are most welcome to join our lovely discord!
See you in-game <3 !
 We believe that role-playing isn't always just about about grinding and growing stats. It's the embodying of a role; the presence of a backstory and all of the quirks and details that define your unique character.
Many of us have experienced old-school role-play around a table with pencils and a bunch of dice. We know how immersive it is to speak like our characters and to be surrounded by other players who are making decisions based on their characters profiles. Role-play truly submerses you in another world, more powerfully than any NPC  quest could.
Imagine a videogame where everyone around you is role-playing. The noble Emere with whom you are travelling does not want to desecrate any tombs and ignores the loot; the Swala hunter you just met chants a ritual prayer before every hunt and the Asiman merchant never attacks or kills anyone because she believes her goddess wants peace to rule in Wagadu.


 For the first time in gaming history we are building an online game 100% tailored to role-players, from lore to mechanics.
These are some of the community features that we are implementing to create this unique environment:
Continuous releases of free lore material.
 In-character role-play as a default for all players when in Wagadu's servers.
Off-world lobbies where players can get technical support or any role-playing tips on how to act out their character before returning to the actual game world.
Rewards for groups of players that engage in interesting and well thought role-playing.
We intend to keep the space safe from harassment and trolls who want to disrupt other people's story and the role-play environment - we are spending a lot of energy on this and will have a number of moderation tools that we and the community can use.
 We have already started building our community on Discord! We chat about the setting, role-playing games and even have a Wagadu role-play coffee-house channel <3 Join our Discord!
pre-alpha footage

 The tabletop RPG books of Wagadu are crucial to this project because they flesh out the lore in a way that a videogame can't. If you want to truly experience and understand role-play in Wagadu, you'll have to take a look at the lore that is in the books. If you decide to focus only on tabletop role-play, your input and user generated content will affect the development of the MMO.
Wagadu is an ecosystem of tabletop and videogame, which can be experienced in different ways depending on personal taste.
Excerpts from our free teaser 5E lore book
Wagadu is a strange place where different types of people fall from another world and have to fight to adapt and survive. Behind the scenes a lot has been done to create this world. We believe that role-playing thrives when the setting is well fleshed out and interesting.
The approach taken to create this fantasy world was: "What if Tolkien were black?". Just as Tolkien did, a lot of time was spent researching the mythologies and traditions of people, but in this case across the African continent. The result is seven "lineages", which are similar to fantasy "races" but more nuanced, with overlapping cultures and more fluid identities.

Many of the lore elements, including some crucial elements of the setting such as the conflict of lineages with slavery or the "Dwen" spirit-children, are inspired by diasporic experiences of black people both in the Americas and in Europe.
To make this fantasy world more authentic we have been in contact with experts such an Africa biologists for the various biomes and  African elders for village lore.
We are sharing a free 300 page guide to the world of Wagadu, that be can directly downloaded here: 

Wagadu's role-play and immersion are so important for us that we built the MMORPG mechanics in tandem with the lore. In the Wagadu Chronicles, world-building and gameplay strengthen each other.
 We are building something that has never been seen before in any MMO, a special cinematic mode called "Dialogue Mode". This is a mode that can be triggered when two or more people chat with each other. It allows for close ups and the use of many animations (from emotions to little show-off spells) you can basically create your own little live show with friends or strangers as you explore and role-play your character's story.
pre-alpha footage
 The 5E setting adapts the usual class system to Wagadu, the MMO takes a freer approach.  You have skill "presets" that look like traditional "classes" but you can freely break away from that and build your own warrior-oracle or farmer-chef, nothing stops you.
Your character is made up of skills that go from 1 (beginner) to 5 (master), every level unlocks more advanced uses of that skill.
There are dozens of skills to choose from, we have many of them nailed down already but we will be looking for feedback (especially from our backers) on what additional skills to add during alpha and beta. Some examples from the current skill set are cartography, divination, archery and animal husbandry.
Every day, every player receives a free bundle of experience points (called "Memories") to invest in skills. No grind required, so you're not penalised if you decide to become a travelling merchant, a coffee-brewer or a tailor: you'll level up just like your mercenary friend.
A special feature of The Wagadu Chronicles are "ancestral blessings". Throughout Wagadu, Ancestors leave skills for players to pick them up, these skills last from a few minutes to an hour and unlock some random power anywhere in the skill tree (and sometimes even completely unique powers that belong to NPC Ancestors). So your Daa'ima bodyguard character may well be able to breathe underwater for an hour or to heal everyone for 15 minutes!
pre-alpha footage
 Just as in other sandbox MMOs, we will leave the economy in the hands of the players. If there are only a few Fire Asimans in the game who can craft fire potions, these will become rare and expensive and people will have to travel more to find where to buy them.
Most items in the game can only be crafted by other players, loot and NPCs will provide only a few basics.
Many items, from pots to clothes, to weapons, can be customized by in-game editors if you have the right skills. No two robes are the same in The Wagadu Chronicles! You can sign your creations and even become a famous in-game designer (and ask higher prices). 
Additionally, every item can be lost or stolen when you get slain - be careful!



 Surviving Wagadu requires interaction with Spirits and Ancestors of all types. Obtaining wood in Wagadu for instance, usually requires interaction with a Tree Spirit. You can convince it to give you some wood by making the right offering but also by behaving in ways the Spirit likes: if in the last few days you have planted and watered seeds in the farm, the Tree Spirit might be more generous to you. If instead you are holding an axe, the outcome might even be a battle. Navigating Spirit requests is made even trickier by the fact that different resource Spirits have conflicting requests and things that they love/hate.
In Wagadu, NPCs remember what you do and act accordingly. Your actions matter.
Another little peculiarity of The Wagadu Chronicles is that your character has a couple of "hidden background" traits: these are features that you inherited from an ancestor (such as descending from an Elephant-Spirit) and that are hiddenly assigned randomly at character creation. Spirits might react upon them, and discovering your hidden backgrounds can be an exciting role-play story and create unexpected bounds with other players.
pre-alpha footage

Totems are central to every player's game, since they:
act as spawn point.
provide healing & safety.
bestow perks (e.g. farming bonus).
allow to place player housing.
  Groups of players can turn an unclaimed  wilderness Totem into a Village Totem by giving it recurrent offerings. This allows players to place housing around it. The type of offerings the Totem asks for varies based on its personality: one might request  30 calves to be born, another Totem might just ask for money.
The Totem requests vary slightly every week and a Totem's personality affects the village's players' gameplay and goals.
Players can make offerings to additional wilderness Totems to add them to their "Totem Pantheon" and get their perks. When two different villages compete for the same Totem, a "Spiritual Challenge" ensues in which the highest bidder wins.
Sheer strength does not always mean victory. A Totem might request that the whole village never goes hunting, so that Lionblood village might give it a pass and let it be claimed by the peaceful clan of farming players that live in the next island.

 The Music of Wagadu is heavily inspired by a combination of African traditional instruments and with western RPG tunes. We aren't just building a refreshingly new soundtrack, we are also creating new associations based on African traditions, such as playing Ghana's bamboo-flute funeral dirge for death-related gameplay and Mali's Dogon bull-roarer for spiritual and ancestral summoning.
 We are collaborating with established traditional Ghanaian musicians such as Dela Botri and professors of the Department of Music of the University of Accra in order to make Wagadu sound truly authentic.
For the voiced parts of the game, we will be collaborating with black voice-actors, such as the iconic, Abubakar Salim ("Bayek" in Assassin's creed Origins) whose amazing voice features in our Kickstarter trailer.
Recording sessions at Kay Boni's Cafe Abajo in Accra, Ghana

Twin Drums is made up of a team of established game developers. We have worked for some of the biggest franchises and gaming companies out there. We have experience of working on different platforms and we are bringing all of these different perspectives into our game development. And yes, we are half black and a third queer: that’s our secret super-power.
To make sure that The Wagadu Chronicles gets all the support it needs, we have partnered with League of Legends developer Riot Games - they have been amazing with us and we are very excited about this collaboration.

 We have some funding and support from a big developer. The Wagadu Chronicles is happening. The reason why we are here is because your support can help us improve the game by increasing our development budget and by joining us in this development journey with your feedback and participation.
Being able to see how many of you care about role-playing and afrofantasy and getting your support will help us make The Wagadu Chronicles the best game that it can possibly be!
 Please note that the price in USD is an approximation based on the original price in Euros since Twin Drums is based in Europe. Prices in USD may vary depending on the USD to EUR exchange rate.
Bear in mind that shipping costs have not been included in the pledges and will have to be paid subsequently. 
We are currently collecting data and negotiating with our suppliers in order to get the best deal for most countries and we will be able to provide exact shipping charges closer to shipment!
Some pledges provide multiple versions of  in-game items as a rewards. This is very special because all items in Wagadu can normally be lost or stolen at death ("full loot") but these backer reward items are "bound to your soul", they cannot be looted. Since we will not be producing them anymore by game release, their value will constantly increase and they will become very rare, expensive and recognisable in the game. It's your choice if to keep them, sell them or gift them to your closest friend.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk is that we are a small team making a relatively big game. If the game is very successful we could end up struggling with our server infrastructure or to produce enough 3D content. This is how we are tackling it:
- We have partnered with a developer, Riot Games, that understands both online infrastructure and how to produce content for big player populations.
- Where possible we are relying on proven architectures and tools like Amazon Web Services and Unity 3D.
- We have different internal 3D art production scenarios, with the possibility of getting freelancer and outsourcing help in the most demanding scenarios.
- We are here crowdfunding not just for useful additional resources but also to get a better understanding of the size of audience; this will allow us to plan accordingly.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
ValiDate is a visual novel in which you maneuver yourself through the twisting paths of young adulthood.  
Set in the Jercy City area, twelve struggling singles in their twenties navigate through the trying ordeals of capitalism to find meaning in their lives. Includes a hint of love, cosplay, and even mediocre mixtapes in the mix.  
 With 12 playable characters and over 30 routes to choose from, there will be about 20-30 hours of content, depending on how you play it. We don't know if you be reading fast or not. Whether your decisions are good, bad, or just tremendously shitty, you’re going to have a great time falling in (or out) of love with these characters.

The sun shines out over a cold Jercy City day. The wind isn’t blowing as hard as it usually does, but you still find yourself hugging your coat a bit closer to your body to shield yourself from the cold. Hurrying yourself along, you duck into a hair salon your friend pointed you towards, and the warmth of a space heater fills your body the moment you step in.
The room is dark, all lights pointed towards the area in the far back that sort of looks like a makeshift stage. It’s full of faces you’ve never seen before -- they look so warm, yet so distraught? Did you just walk into a cult?
You decide to sit yourself in the corner, pulling out your phone to text one of your friends, hoping one can help you in your time of need.
Who will you text?

Can you imagine what happens when you put twelve struggling single adults in a room and tell them to interact? Neither can we. ValiDate is a game set in modern day Jercy City in which you have to survive as an adult in your twenties. Difficult? Hell yeah, have you seen the price of rent lately?
The goal is to survive and maybe attempt to date -- but you might ultimately realize that the world isn’t on your side and you’re incapable of love. Or are you? Much like in real life, you’ll have to check out all your options first.
This game will include content or themes that may not be suitable for all ages, such as swearing, mentions of death, drugs, alcohol, and sexual situations. Player discretion is advised.
Demo can be found on Itch.io here!
12 playable characters with 30+ routes.
 The ability to choose horrible decisions and see the entertaining fallout.
 #OwnVoices narrative writing by an all people of color team.
 Original score by the Boys. 
A beautiful array of artists of color's work to give each character their own individual feeling. 
Backgrounds taken from all around the world. 
Flawed characters undergoing narrative arcs handled with empathy and self-indulgence.
Achievements for every single ending

campaign.story:
Today August 1, 2020, we are fighting opposing forces in a pandemic that have affected billions globally. Many are scared, many refuse to back down, and many have no clue what will come next. Hope is like a candlelight striving to stay bright among all of the darkness. In Cede, are you this candlelight fighting a famine similar to the global impact of a pandemic as well as a worldwide power imbalance among billions of lifeforms. There are ways of the world that are holding us back from experiencing ultimate glory, freedom, and love. We are not just physical beings, we are spiritual and mental beings as well. So let's go beyond surface level into the soul and spirit to understand how we must move on the surface. Join the movement of our project game Cede and tell the world how we can unlock from whats holding us back and put actions into place with these words. 
 ADD ONS:
You can add rewards to your current tier. Just change your pledge amount to add the additional amount from your add-on(s) and we will see this addition along with a note from you during surveys.
 Combat Farming - upon defeating a lifeform will transform them into environment changers (plants) that assist you through combat in various ways. Dropping health, increasing stats, help fighting against opposing lifeforms, and more. The power of your squad is primarily based off how many plants you have grown. 
 Cede is a 3D action packed combat farming game that focuses heavily on combat enhanced by changing the environment around you. The more you grow the stronger your squad becomes. 
 4 Player Co-op Campaign - When we originally started Cede, we only planned for a single player experience. We took Cede to many conventions like PAX, DreamHack, and GDC. Many of our fans deeply expressed their desire for a cooperative experience. We grew up on 4 Co-op games which brought us together for many great experiences. Cede will have a 4 player Co-op campaign. One player will play with Seph while the remaining three players will choose different characters to join the venture. 
  Powerful story and Replayability - Every playthrough of Cede will provide a unique experience through how you grow environment changers in hundreds of combat scenarios. In just one area you may have grown a bunch of trees based on random large lifeforms who will enter the environment versus another player who entered the same area and grown small flowers from random small lifeforms.  The story is intertwined with what and how you are growing around the world. 
 Swarm combat = More Growth + More Loot - Yep! Combat will be crazy hectic with swarms of opposing lifeforms attempting to overthrow you and accomplish their goals. This means upon defeating them more beautiful plant life will fill the environment and these plants will drop loot for you to take back to your hub farm. 
 Hub Farm - Bring back loot you've found while combat farming in different areas to your own personal hub farm to grow and harvest crops. Use these crops to get stronger and build custom loadouts. Cede will also have an exchange ecosystem between players.
We are updating Seph design to the coolness you see above. The old design we felt did not translate well in 3D, primarily his legs were really short. We extended his legs and giving him some cool clothes so that he's not nakey lol. 
Seph, Lil Boi's, and other unannounced playable characters will all have a full on set of abilities/skills for a more dynamic action rpg combat style. These abilities will still effect environment changers in various ways. 
The planet's state before the chaotic conflict and after.
Seph and Lil Bush in the wilderness
Environment changer concepts
Our game won't be a Pay to Win type of game, I've been asked that by some of you. I will clarify these items with you all on our youtube channel and email list. 
Initial Release
Cede will release on windows first. We haven't finalized which platform we will release on (steam, itch, epic, website), but we will keep you all updated on through the campaign. Just know that whatever we move forward with, it will be compatible with the ecosystems we are pushing for while ensuring a smooth gaming experience. We have plans for console release in the future after our windows release. 
Checkout some of our contributors and we are currently looking for more talent to join our amazing squad. 

Despite not reaching the funding goal in our last kickstarter campaign we gained something really powerful, a connection with many of you. It really boosted our morale to see new people who believed in Cede. Kickstarter is a platform which helps us make the connection with you and reach new souls. I firmly believe in connecting with the soul and spirit first then the funding and resources will come along. We are on a mission and want to invite those who align with that mission to join our family.  Together we shall win and shift energy to bring balance in areas of need. 
Let me quote a point from our last campaign at the bottom of the page "Again we DO NOT want to go to a publisher for the capital to finish this game. If we reach the initial funding goal and nothing more, then we will have to resort to additional funding from a publisher or investor to finish. Our game is currently in the prototype phase and $40K would get our game to a fully fleshed out alpha to secure a publisher. " Despite not reaching the funding goal in our last campaign, I did not let that stop us from creating the a demo to pitch to publishers. At this point I feel like we have nothing to prove that we have the capacity to make an amazing game based on what we've been able to pull off with little to no money. We have a demo and many of you have played it at PAX, GDC, and other events. The demo just doesn't do the final vision justice, but know that we have one.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
DELAY
The way we are developing Cede and the decentralization opportunities we are providing is very unorthodox compared to common development models. Games take thousands/millions of dollars to create and we have been developing Cede with the little resources we have available. That being said the game may take longer than usual to develop. Of course if we raise way beyond our funding goal this can speed up the process. It's like asking someone to build a full house with just a baby garden shovel versus aiding them with the finances to increase team power and tools to build more effectively.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Cede has replayability through our combat farming design. Every experience will be different due to the random lifeforms that appear along with random environment changers (plants) that they transform into. The world you've grown will look different from another player.

It's not what you say, it's how you say it. We should talk is a short-form narrative game that will make you think carefully about the words you choose, coming Summer 2020 to Windows, Mac, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch. 
In We should talk, you'll use the sentence spinner to piece together modular sentences in response to the in-game characters. Choose your words carefully to express yourself as you discuss ongoing problems about life and romance with Sam, your in-game partner, over text messages, while also chatting with friends and strangers at your favorite local bar.
The combination of words you choose impacts the conversations you have, how genuinely you can connect with your partner, and whether your relationship can survive the night. It's up to you how to respond—depending on how you communicate, you'll see one of 9 possible endings. 
Personalized Choices: Using the sentence spinner, make choices that connect with you. Countless options abound—be yourself, or role play someone you never thought you could be.
Unique Characters: Your night at the bar is more interesting thanks to all the unique people you encounter. Find your healthy balance between chatting with your friends and keeping up with the texts from your partner at home. 
Different Paths: Your choices drastically affect the way folks respond to you, leading to one of many different paths in each conversation. Will you be accommodating, flirty, stand-offish, or somewhere in-between?
Multiple endings: Play again and again to find all 9 possible endings. Conclusions aren't based on a specific path or route the way many traditional narrative games branch, but instead the endings are based on the tone your responses express throughout the game. What do your relationships look like at the end of the night?
Realistic conversations: Experience the emotions that come with real conversations, whether it’s the the joy that comes with teasing a friend, the anxiety that comes with a heavy text message, or the frustration of navigating a touchy conversation with a creep. Express yourself as clearly as you can and hope that your conversational partner understands, though there's always a risk they might interpret your words differently than you intended.
The development of We should talk is close to completion, so we're turning to Kickstarter to help our launch be as strong as possible. Our team hoped to present We should talk at a number of global events this spring and summer as we near the game's release, but the pandemic threw a wrench in our plans. We're raising money to help us pay for marketing and promotional efforts post-launch so that we can try to reach more people through digital media. We know this project is important and deserves to be seen by folks who would benefit from its message, and we feel that Kickstarter is the best way to help us make that happen. We plan to use the money we raise to help us advertise through social media, sponsorship, and other available marketing avenues. 
Francesca, Carol, Jordan & Nobonita
We should talk was created by Nobonita Bhowmik, Francesca Carletto-Leon, Jordan Jones-Brewster, Carol Mertz, Kat Aguiar, and Jack Schlesinger—six developers that met as MFA students at the NYU Game Center. Our team came together with the goal of creating a game that challenges traditional transactional romance in games, and collaborated to push relationship-building games forward by expanding the realm of player choice. While the game started with all of us together in Brooklyn, NY, our team members now span as far globally as Bangladesh, Japan, St. Louis, MO, and Madison, WI.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The development of We should talk is finished! The game is already in the process of certification and approval for consoles, and available to wishlist on Steam, with a pre-approved build. That said, there are very few risks at this point in development, other than a potential delay in our release due to COVID-19 and other economic and industry roadblocks.

We are offering some Kickstarter tiers that allow Backers to contribute content to the game, and do know that can often be a source of delay. We won't allow backer-written content and credits to delay us unnecessarily, and plan to enforce strict deadlines on reward surveys so that we can get credits and content in the Steam version of the game in time for our anticipated summer launch.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
UPDATE!!! Onsen Master will be coming to console! Read more on that here.
MULTIPLAYER?! Check out that announcement here!
Try things out for yourself and see the game so far! Available ONLY during the Kickstarter on itch.io (controller required).
 What's a Stretch Goal? Read more here!
Onsen Master is a single-player hot spring customer management game coming to PC, Mac, Linux and now console, late 2020. Players must revitalize various onsens across the fantasy island of Izajima! Create ingredients to match the various customer ailments, reconnect the communities that surround the onsens and discover the supernatural world that they've long since been disconnected from.
Short and sweet single-player story across 6 hot spring levels
Visual novel style dialogue with a cute anime aesthetic 
Arcade mode to skip the story and dive right in
An original soundtrack
Inspired Hayao Miyazaki's Spirited Away and great game titles like Overcooked and Diner Dash, Onsen Master matches a colorful fantasy world with frantic customer and hot spring management. 
As Mu, players will travel to various hot springs across Izajima to manage onsens populated by unique customers and Japanese spirits, called yokai. As patrons queue within the onsen, your goal is to create ingredients that will solve a variety of ailments within the time limit. 
Onsen Master consists of three main tasks: Greet the customer, Mix your ingredients and Heal their ailments! 
Customers will queue at the entrance of each onsen and wait for you to guide them to a bath. Be sure to assist them quickly, as each customer has a timer and depending on your speed of service you can receive a nice chunk of change to influence your final score, but if the timer runs out they will leave the onsen!
Once you've sorted your customer, it's time to select an ingredient that matches their needs and head to the mixing station! There you will turn your ingredient into its final solution and dump it into the customer's bath to heal them. 
But that's not all you'll be managing; unruly customers and Japanese spirits called "yokai" have come to the onsen as well and with them they bring unique ailments and behaviors to throw you off of your routine. Keep a keen eye for these characters and help them efficiently, or else they may cause quite the ruckus! 
 Onsen Master is a story about healing, set in fantasy feudal Japan. As Mu, you've been tasked with filling the shoes of your missing sensei, the great "Onsen Master". Since their disappearance, onsens across the island of Izajima as well as the harmony between its peoples has fallen into shambles. It is now up to you to restore the balance and uncover what happened to the previous master. 
The towns in Onsen Master are home to a variety of people with unique moods and behaviors. While most customers are pretty easy going, others will need special attention as they might cut in line or roughhouse with other patrons!
The people of Izajima aren't the only ones interested in attending the local hot springs. Yokai (Japanese spirits) are also about and will be making their way into the various onsen. They are sure to bring with them their unique habits like licking customers, creating slippery puddle, and chasing Mu!
Onsen Master takes place on the island of Izajima. Apart from restoring your own onsen, you'll visit the islands varied locations and the inhabitants that reside within them.
Don't let the cozy simplicity of Nakatsukuni Onsen from the prototype fool you! Izajima Island's other onsens each come with a variety of unique challenges for prospective Onsen Master's to overcome! From Umiguchi's bustling restaurant patrons stumbling directly into the nearest bath to Furuki's living tree picking up and moving baths, the challenges will be sure to provide a surprising variety!
Want to know more? Check out part one of our Onsen Deep Dives in Update #2!
Creating an original soundtrack for Onsen Master is essential and composer Dorrell Ettienne will be delivering a wonderfully imaginative composition to the game! Have a listen to our Main Theme and be sure to follow up with Dorrell for more of their work!
 So how do add-ons work?
Hit "Manage your pledge", located at the top of this page.
In the "Pledge amount" add your add-on amount on top of your current total.
Save your pledge.
At the end of the campaign we will send you a survey to confirm what add-ons you want to receive 
Onsen Master is a collaborative project between 5 passionate individuals that are dedicated to realizing a Ghibli-like dream. We have been supporting Onsen Master with much smaller wallets and now turn to Kickstarter in hopes to build a community interested in supporting our development and eventual launch. We also hope of launching Onsen Master to console and bringing local multiplayer, but we need your help!
Derrick Fields (@wakingoni) is the lead designer, 3D artist, and general "many job doer" on Onsen Master. He loves to create art derived from African American and Japanese media and culture. One can usually find him spending time with his family or playing a great deal of Sea of Thieves. 
Tim Robinson (@lightshaper_) is the other lead designer, producer, project manager, and wearer of an indeterminate amount of development hats. Who knows what he’s actually like beneath all of those hats. He can usually be found near coffee and some say that if he strays too far from it that he will age instantly into dust.
Leo Riveron (@leolicos) leads all of programming and technology on Onsen Master.  He is a Game Developer by day, cosplayer and ninja warrior by night, and loves to make music in his free time.  Out in the wild, he can usually be found climbing on something he probably shouldn't.
Sarah Gavagan (@gavagan_sarah) works on character and level concepts for Onsen Master. Her work plays with nature and mythology, and draws a lot of inspiration from printmaking and the natural world. If you don't run into her making sushi part-time at her local izakaya, she's escaped yet again to volunteer on farms catching bees, picking weeds and following cats she finds on the street. 
Dorrell Ettienne (@dorrellettienne) is the Composer for Onsen Master but could be better referred to as a sound wizard who creates imaginative music for media. He maintains a large interest in Japanese culture and the arts.
We love what we have created for Onsen Master so far and hope that we can go on to develop more. All of the team members have been contributing to this project part-time, with any availability made from their jobs and personal lives. Any expenses revolving this project has been paid for out of pocket, so developing a supportive community through Kickstarter would enable us to deliver a game directly to an audience that is as passionate as we are. 
In short, a couple friendly devs have told us of their even friendlier audiences and we hope Onsen Master can be apart of that. Thanks!
Let's be real, completing a game on $10k is a tight budget. That is why we feel that scaling down on our first game  is an honest approach to ensuring that we are not biting off more than we can chew and still be able to provide our audience with a fun experience. We have a few stretch goals, but created them in a way that we feel keeps us right on target for our release of late Q4 2020. Should we greatly exceed those goals, it is very important to us to not expand our scope any larger for our own mental health and you getting exactly the game you came for.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We fully understand that there will be more than a few bumps on the road ahead of us, especially with a small team. That said, we want to make sure that we always remain respectful and transparent with our supporters, keeping you well informed throughout our development.

There are some talented hands at work and even better ones, supporting us should we face any major hurdles. The version of Onsen Master we have now is right along with our project's overall scope and we feel very confident that we will be able to see to its completion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
